content: We mash bits and atoms together into interactive products and art installations. We are the Ministry of Extraordinary Affairs.
studio.name: intro

content: The Ministry of Extraordinary Affairs is a studio for design engineering and creative development, focusing on conceptual design and development of intelligent, interactive, inspirational & connected products and experiences.

We bring extraordinary ideas to life. We create meaningful products and inspirational experiences. We see our projects as material manifestations of great ideas. We paint with innovative technologies, and our canvas is the world.
studio.name: about

projects.name: Welcome To Oogaland
description: Welcome to Oogaland! These happy little creatures are always friendly and cheerful. They laugh and play and dance around. But when people are around, they get a little shy. They stand stiff, and follow everything that moves with their big expressive eye. Are you close? They like it when you pet them. You can feel and hear them purring with pleasure.

With the interactive Welcome to Oogaland! installation, talented Dutch designer Nikolai Gillissen takes you back to the comic books and cartoons of your childhood. Audiences of all ages will be amazed when playing with the Ooga, which react to your movements and touches.

projects.name: Sonos Ignitia
description: Sonos Ignitia stands for ‘the land of sound and fire’. A living landscape of flame that visibly and audibly undulates around you. It takes you on a journey through the heart of a composition of sound, light and heat. The feelings it evokes alternate between meditative and compelling, digital and analogue, technical and poetic, intimate and bombastic.
Sound controls the flames, bringing them to life and making them dance. Like a landscape inhabited by a composition of light, sound and heat.
For this project, the Ministry of Extraordinary Affairs was responsible for the conceptual design, project management, and technical realisation.

projects.name: Tullep
description: We're growing tulips out of marine trash. For the province of Noord Holland, The Ministry of Extraordinary Affairs created a promotional gift based on the principles of the circular economy. It consists of a series of unique table lamps that combines two of the most iconic Dutch elements, tulips and the sea. A green keepsake for the Provinces international relations.

projects.name: Smart Locks
description: Access management is not easy, especially when your tenants are short-stay students. Before GuestCompass, their clients had to deal with missed checkouts and lost keys on a daily basis. Their app makes the life of both owner and tenants way easier trough integrating communication and acces controls.

The Ministry of Extraordinary Affaris developed the system connecting the GuestCompass app to the door locks, in a way that is very safe, extremely reliable and cost-friendly. We created prototypes using different technologies (WiFi- and LoRa-based), tested them in a real world scenario, and developed the final products based on our findings.

projects.name: LEDbits
description: LEDs have many advantages over traditional lightbulbs, yet designing luminaires using High Power LEDs is no easy feat. Together with Studio Philip Ross and PicusLED, The Ministry of Extraordinary Affairs created a toolkit that makes designing with LEDs as easy as choosing a light color, shaping the beam and hooking up the controls. This plug-and-play system puts the power in the hands of the designer, no technical knowledge required. No need for expensive engineering or old-school retrofit lightbulbs.
The Ministry of Extraordinary Affairs was responsible for the conceptual design, presentation and engineering of the control modules.

projects.name: anTU/enna
description: Har Hollands transformed the old chimney on the Eindhoven University of Technology into a huge LED matrix display for science-related animations. During the Glow 2016 festival, it played animations of DNA sequencing, networking, wind and water simulations and more.

The Ministry of Extraordinary Affairs created a crowd-based audio system to play the audio from the animations. Visitors could visit a website on their phone, and the audio would start playing, perfectly in sync with both the imagery and the phones of others on location.

projects.name: Beach Ball 2.0
description: Beach Ball is a fun game to play at the beach, yet has not seen much innovation in the past 100 years. [undisclosed client] aims to bring new innovation by creating smart rackets that keeps international high scores, and different single- and multiplayer games to the beach. In collaboration with B-Engineering, the Ministry of Extraordinary Affairs created a working prototype of this idea, that [undisclosed client] could use to validate their claims and bring potential investors on board.

projects.name: Various Prototyping & Art Installations
description: The Ministry of Extraordinary Affairs created various interactive prototypes for clients with great ideas but without technical know-how. We created working prototypes for idea validation, interactive products and technology demonstrators. We created interactive elements for various art installations. We love working with designers and artists, and can devise solutions for all sorts of projects and budgets.
